comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Potentially the daughter of Benjamin A. Willis, Democratic U.S. Representative from New York.

comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Confirmed: "The Prettiest Suffragette in New York State," Portia Willis was born to a well-connected and politically active New York City family, circa 1887. The distinguished Civil War service of her father, Colonel Benjamin A. Willis, led to his election to the U.S. House of Representatives. Her mother, Lillie Evelynn Macauley Willis was prominent in the New York City social scene. — Portia Willis Fitzgerald Papers, 1868-1966 Her beauty is in evidence here: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5125512659/]
